lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._2d

Class SplineGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._2d.SplineGenerator

  • public class SplineGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains several utility methods for converting waypoints (2d) into profiles.
    Author:
    Tiger Huang

        public SplineGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • splinesFromWaypoints

        public static QuinticBezier[] splinesFromWaypoints(Waypoint[] waypoints)
        Creates a list of QuinticBeziers from a list of waypoints.
        Parameters:
        waypoints - an array of waypoints to use
        Returns:
        an array of QuinticBeziers that satisfies the waypoints

      • flattenProfile

        public static double[][] flattenProfile(QuinticBezier[] splines,
                                        int initial_sample_count,
                                        double initial_sample_length)
        Flattens a list of QuinticBeziers into a list of differences of distance and rotation.
        Parameters:
        splines - an array of QuinticBeziers to flatten
        initial_sample_count - the number of sample to take when finding the arc length
        initial_sample_length - the delta arc length the output should be separated by
        Returns:
        an array containing differences of distance and rotation
        The format is [ds0, dtheta0; ds1, dtheta1; ...]

      • flattenPseudoProfile

        public static double[][] flattenPseudoProfile(double s0,
                                              double a0,
                                              double s1,
                                              double a1,
                                              double sampleLength)
        Creates a profile based on mostly independent translational and rotational movements. Be cautious when using with larger rotations because the robot will drive an arc.
        Parameters:
        s0 - Initial position
        a0 - Initial rotation
        s1 - Final position
        a1 - Final rotation
        sampleLength - the target length of each segment
        Returns:
        an array containing differences of distance and rotation
        The format is [ds0, dtheta0; ds1, dtheta1; ...]
